Key Match Events: India lost the three-match ODI series 2-0 against Sri Lanka.
Washington Sundar and Riyan Parag's bowling were notable positives for India.
Shreyas Iyer was dismissed during the third ODI.
Rishabh Pant returned to the one-day set-up but lasted only nine deliveries.
Arshdeep Singh was unimpressive in the two games he played.
Post-Match Reflections: Gautam Gambhir's tenure as head coach started promisingly with a 3-0 whitewash of Sri Lanka in the T20Is before the ODI series loss.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that the team did not put Sri Lanka under pressure.
The team management has plenty to ponder going forward, especially with the absence of key players like Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya.
Gambhir's vision for the team includes having more all-rounders and batters who can bowl.
The team did not get much headway in answering the question about the third seamer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The conditions in the one-dayers were spin-friendly, making batting progressively tricky.
India's batting depth extended to eight and even nine in the final one-dayer by playing all-rounders Shivam Dube, Washington Sundar, and Riyan Parag.
The preference to have a left-handed and right-handed batter in the middle was evident throughout the tour.
